segments.text: I see the woman drying that plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s standing in a puddle, and she doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just gushing over the edge of the sink, and she’s completely ignoring it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she might be sleepwalking or something.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are right behind her, stealing cookies, and she has no clue.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s ever going to notice the mess or the kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is going to be ruined if she doesn’t turn off the water soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she looks while everything is going wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are going to slip on that wet floor, and she won’t even react.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone needs to shake her out of whatever daydream she’s in.
segments.speaker: PAR
